column3: Fix Zipkin receiver wrong condition for decoding `gzip`
column4: Zipkin receiver used `accept-encoding` to identify the agent report is a  gzip content, fix it to  `Content-Encoding`.  ### Fix Zipkin receiver wrong condition for decoding `gzip` - [ ] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works. - [X] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #8267. - [X] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).

column3: Fix saving Process Traffic error when cluster mode
column4: When receiving the process keepalive protocol in cluster mode, It will throw an exception when balancing the process traffic data. Because the gRPC could not be added a null value(`ProcessTraffic#agentID`) into the data. So I update the agent id to the `Const#EMPTY_STRING` to fix it.   The Process traffic is new in the current milestone, so I don't need to update the changelog.  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [ ] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/changelog/docs/en/changes/changes.md).

column3: Add `VIRTUAL` detect type to Process for Network Profiling
column4: When querying Process, exclude all Virtual type data, this part of the data will only be useful in Network Profiling.  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/changes/changes.md).

column3: Fix the pod match error when the service has multiple selector in kubernates environment.
column4: When OAP received the metrics from OTEL and bound it to the K8S_SERVICE entity, I found that when the Service has multiple selectors, the matching rules between service and pod are incorrect.  The current match rule is that as long as any selector in the service matches the label in the pod, it is considered a match and should be changed to match all.  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/changelog/docs/en/changes/changes.md).

column3: Use the plugin version defined by the Apache maven parent
column4: Use the plugin version defined by the Apache maven parent Delete target field in the `java-doc` configuration  These are the upgraded versions: ``` maven-dependency-plugin 2.10 - 3.2.0 maven-assembly-plugin   3.1.0 - 3.3.0 maven-failsafe-plugin   2.22.0 - 2.22.2 maven-surefire-plugin   2.22.0 - 2.22.2 maven-jar-plugin        3.1.0 - 3.2.2 maven-enforcer-plugin   3.0.0-M2 - 3.0.0 maven-compiler-plugin 3.8.0 - 3.10.0 maven-resources-plugin 3.1.0 - 3.2.0 maven-source-plugin    3.0.1 - 3.2.1 ```  - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).

column3: [Enhancement] Bump grpc and protobuff version to allow building on Mac M1
column4: Upgrade to the latest grpc-java 1.42.1 which is only compatible and [tested against](https://github.com/grpc/grpc-java/pull/8551#discussion_r714182190) 3.17.2, but we can assume that 3.17.3 (which has osx-aarch_64 compatible maven artifacts) is save to use.  We could have also upgrade to the latest grpc-java 1.42.1 and latest protoc 3.19.1, but it can not be directly done, it needs to tweak the grpcs-java internal dependencies. So we choose the safest option and discarded this option because of the following reasons:  - Protoc 3.19.1 generates code that relies on methods not available in protobuf-java 3.17.2 ([â€œissueâ€](https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf/issues/9236#issue-1059594027)) (which java-grpc relies on). So we need to tell grpc-java via dependency management to use 3.19.1 instead of 3.17.2.  ` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. , . column3: ElasticSearch: scroll id should be updated when scrolling as it may change
column4: This partially reverts #9128 , originally I deleted the scroll id when I scroll one time, later that @mrproliu modified in #9128 to only delete the scroll id after the scroll is done, in #9128 we assumed that the scroll id is not changed but that's not the case, according to https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/client/php-api/current/search_operations.html   ```     // When done, get the new scroll_id     // You must always refresh your _scroll_id!  It can change sometimes     $scroll_id = $response['_scroll_id']; ```  ^^^ found by @wankai123 (thanks ðŸ™‡) and it becomes painful due to "It can change sometimes".  SO in this PR I just save the scroll ids and when done delete them all at once.

column3: Fix the so11y latency of persistence execution latency not correct in ElasticSearch storage
column4: The ES persistence execution is now asynchronous and the execution latency only counts the time to insert the requests into the bulk processor, instead of the time after the requests are flushed into the storage, this patch fixes that issue.  There is the same issue in prepare latency but that needs more changes so I'll leave it to another pull request.  ` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. , . column3: Enhance CI skipping strategy
column4: The current CI skipping strategy relies on a suboptimal mechanism that is hard to tune.   This PR enhances the process to exclude files and we can add more whenever we need. Please take a look and make sure I did nothing wrong.  I also turned on the dead link checker schedule for the upstream repo only.  BTW, some of the e2e tests are flaky - like fluent-bit, shall we increase the retry times? ` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. , . column3: Use https for submodules to permit non-authenticated use
column4: Not a code bug or feature, but a minor tweak to your git modules configuration.  When cloning the code, if the user is unauthenticated they are rejected on one of the submodules with a message requesting your SSH key password, due to the .gitmodules file using `git@github.com` as opposed to `https://github.com/`.  This prevents users without Github accounts from checking out the code (without mucking about), and blocks the use of tools such as Sonatype Lift.  ` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. , . column3: Add `forEach`, `processRelation` function to MAL Expression, and add `expPrefix` in MAL config
column4: I'm preparing network profiling based on eBPF, it needs to complete the process relation through MAL.  1. Add `forEach`, `processRelation` function to MAL Expression. 2. Add `expPrefix` in MAL config. 3. Add `ProcessRegistry` to generate the process dynamically.   Here is an example, I will add the configuration after the network analysis function is complete. ```yaml expSuffix: |-   processRelation('side', ['service'], ['instance'], 'client_process_id', 'server_process_id') expPrefix: |-   forEach(['client', 'server'], { prefix, tags ->     if (tags[prefix + '_process_id'] != null) {       return     }     if (tags[prefix + '_local'] == 'true') {       tags[prefix + '_process_id'] = ProcessRegistry.generateVirtualLocalProcess(tags.service, tags.instance)       return     }     tags[prefix + '_process_id'] = ProcessRegistry.generateVirtualRemoteProcess(tags.service, tags.instance, tags[prefix + '_address'])   }) metricPrefix: network_profiling metricsRules:   - name: write_bytes     exp:  rover_network_monitor_write_bytes_counter.sum(['service', 'instance', 'side', 'client_process_id', 'server_process_id']) ```  - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [x] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [x] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/changes/changes.md).

column3: Remove filter for Istiod monitor to reduce the prerequisites of job name matching
column4: I found out the reason why there is no conflict between Istio and so11y in https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/8157#discussion_r753153239 is the `istio-controlplane.yaml` has already filter the metrics by tag `app == istiod`, and since we also have filter for so11y since https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/8157, I think we can safely remove the filter in `istio-controlplane.yaml` so that the users don't bother to check the job name in OTEL and the filter name in our file `istio-controlplane.yaml`, which reduce extra work and confusion if users found there is no data on UI, just because of the names' not matching.

column3: Introduce the Customized ALS Protocol for Satellite
column4: I am working on improving the performance of transparent message transmission for the [skywalking-satellite](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-satellite) project.  Then I realize the  ALS protocol needed to operate the stream on each identity stream message. The satellite needs more resources and time. This is especially true when envoys are high in number.   Here is a performance test, using `2300` envoy instances are used to transparently transmit ALS messages to OAP through satellite, at a rate of `2.3K+` QPS. Then the satellite memory is full and not stable.  satellite so11y: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3417650/143766374-75714a27-cfd1-4fb7-983a-b17e02e51e37.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3417650/143766386-9c6cc432-7256-41e3-9ffe-5c51ea88d196.png)  OAP so11y(cluster): ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3417650/143766407-854561ed-3ca8-41c8-a5df-460a10ecec5c.png)  I have tried to cache the stream on the satellite side, but more resources are wasted due to resource preemption. So I think we could dependency on the gRPC streaming messages are order feature, using the same stream to send cross identity messages.   After that, I did a test in this way, and the efficiency of sending ALS messages to OAP was improved, and the memory queue of the satellite was more stable.  This new protocol is copied from ALS and will only be called by the satellite.  Here have some screenshots to see the effect after optimization. Here, `2300` envoy instances are used to transparently transmit ALS messages to OAP through satellite, at a rate of `120K+` QPS. The ALS message tab is read from the `oap`, `envoy_als_in_count` metric.   satellite so11y: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3417650/143689284-34dbd71b-0d21-4325-a32b-458c98470998.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3417650/143689297-4824c7d7-850d-451f-8243-b05935729e25.png)  oap so11y(cluster): ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3417650/143766440-f04c8f22-7b45-4a54-81c8-04950e1f0bd0.png)  - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).

column3: IoTDB storage plugin
column4: Hi, I am a participant in [Summer 2021 of Open Source Promotion Plan](https://summer.iscas.ac.cn/#/homepage). [Here](https://summer.iscas.ac.cn/#/org/prodetail/210070771) is my project homepage. Now I have finished my project under the guidance of @jixuan1989 from IoTDB and @wu-sheng from Skywalking. However, I still have much work to do. This PR will help me find more bug and deficiencies of my work.  I have written a [blog](https://blog.csdn.net/weixin_44023810/article/details/120555823) to introduce the design of IoTDB storage plugin.  This is a large module for Skywalking. I wrote more than 5 thousand source code lines and comment lines. They contains the core code and unit tests. When I wrote the code, I took the other storage plugin as a reference.  IoTDB doesn't have the index concept. In order to index some fields, I store the value of the index as a node of the storage path. Those nodes in storage path will be stored in the memory, so they serve as index. Eventually the data from the same table is spread across multiple devices. But IoTDB does not support cross-device query well. When I need use aggregation query (e.g. `max`, `avg`, `sum`), sort query (e.g. `order by`) or pagination query (e.g. `limit`, `offset`), I have to use a violence method that query all data meets the condition and then sort, aggregate or paginate them.  Although I have run and tested this IoTDB storage plugin locally, I know it is not enough and it need e2e tests at least. Hope you review my work and give me some suggestions.  - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).

column3: Application for cooperation from Goodrain open source community
column4: Hello,I'm from the open source community [Goodrain](https://github.com/goodrain).The open source project we operate is [Rainbond](https://github.com/goodrain/rainbond).Our [website](https://www.rainbond.com/).  We have many users using skywalking.So we provide a choice for these users through Rainbond through our own application market mechanism.One-click deployment of Skywalking available for production.This kind of deployment is very popular with community users.  Therefore, a possibility of cooperation is hereby put forward,We are willing to submit an one-click deployment Skywalking document to your website or blog,Help more users who need both cloud native application management platform and Skywalking to understand this possibility and its convenience.  You can watch the way we worked with [Nacos](https://nacos.io/zh-cn/blog/use-nacos-with-rainbond.html) and [Apollo](https://www.apolloconfig.com/#/zh/deployment/third-party-tool-rainbond) in the past.  Looking forward to the reply from the operators of the Skywalking community!ðŸ˜š

column3: Remove unnecessary time range check in eBPF profiling analysis
column4: Currently, the eBPF profiling analysis has the max schedule time range check, but it's not necessary. So I remove it, I think we limit the query data timeout(the 30s) is enough. So delete it.   - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [ ] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/changelog/docs/en/changes/changes.md).

column3: Overhaul UI dependencies' licenses
column4: A reminder, we should overhaul https://github.com/apache/skywalking/tree/master/dist-material/release-docs/licenses/ui-licenses accordingly as the UI project is completely replaced and must have some dependencies' changes  _Originally posted by @kezhenxu94 in https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/8637#discussion_r821646311_

column3: NPE fix for IndexController#getPhysicalTableName
column4: `Optional.of().orElse()` doesn't make sense. I got an NPE when I searched for a missing table name. I'm not sure if this is the correct fix. Maybe the NPE is expected? If so, the `orElse` should be removed then as it's pointless.

column3: Python: Error installing packages with latest version of Python agent
column4: ``` $ pip install -r requirements.txt  ...  Collecting mysqlclient==2.1.0   Using cached mysqlclient-2.1.0.tar.gz (87 kB)   Preparing metadata (setup.py) ... error   error: subprocess-exited-with-error    Ã— python setup.py egg_info did not run successfully.   â”‚ exit code: 1   â•°â”€> [16 lines of output]       /bin/sh: 1: mysql_config: not found       /bin/sh: 1: mariadb_config: not found       /bin/sh: 1: mysql_config: not found       Traceback (most recent call last):         File "", line 2, in          File "", line 34, in          File "/tmp/pip-install-rnv1f4jm/mysqlclient_48b8558df20a401997c7d351a009a80e/setup.py", line 15, in            metadata, options = get_config()         File "/tmp/pip-install-rnv1f4jm/mysqlclient_48b8558df20a401997c7d351a009a80e/setup_posix.py", line 70, in get_config           libs = mysql_config("libs")         File "/tmp/pip-install-rnv1f4jm/mysqlclient_48b8558df20a401997c7d351a009a80e/setup_posix.py", line 31, in mysql_config           raise OSError("{} not found".format(_mysql_config_path))       OSError: mysql_config not found       mysql_config --version       mariadb_config --version       mysql_config --libs       [end of output]    note: This error originates from a subprocess, and is likely not a problem with pip. error: metadata-generation-failed  Ã— Encountered error while generating package metadata. â•°â”€> See above for output. ```

column3: Fix the kafka consumer configuration override bug.
column4: ` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. , .     Put an `x` in the `[ ]` to mark the item as CHECKED. `[x]` -->   - [] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works. - [ ] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.      ==== ðŸ› Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're fixing a bug, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] Add a benchmark for the improvement, refer to [the existing ones](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/apm-commons/apm-datacarrier/src/test/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/commons/datacarrier/LinkedArrayBenchmark.java) - [ ] The benchmark result. ```text  ``` - [ ] Links/URLs to the theory proof or discussion articles/blogs.       ==== ðŸ“ˆ Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're improving the performance, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [ ] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.      ==== ðŸ†• Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're adding a new feature, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/changelog/docs/en/changes/changes.md).   When I try the configuration below to set different consumer group for oap server, it doesn't work. Still the default group in the program.  ```yaml kafka-fetcher:   selector: ${SW_KAFKA_FETCHER:default}   default:     bootstrapServers: ${SW_KAFKA_FETCHER_SERVERS:192.168.101.1:9092}     ......     kafkaConsumerConfig:       enable.auto.commit: true       group.id: test-group-mysql ```  The reason is that there is an order problem when setting in the code:  ```java properties = new Properties(); properties.putAll(config.getKafkaConsumerConfig()); properties.setProperty(ConsumerConfig.GROUP_ID_CONFIG, config.getGroupId()); properties.setProperty(ConsumerConfig.BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS_CONFIG, config.getBootstrapServers()); ```  I don't know if this is by design or a mistake in itself. Please confirm.

column3: Improve CI with the GHA new feature
column4: ` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. , .     Put an `x` in the `[ ]` to mark the item as CHECKED. `[x]` -->   - [ ] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works. - [ ] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.      ==== ðŸ› Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're fixing a bug, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] Add a benchmark for the improvement, refer to [the existing ones](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/apm-commons/apm-datacarrier/src/test/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/commons/datacarrier/LinkedArrayBenchmark.java) - [ ] The benchmark result. ```text  ``` - [ ] Links/URLs to the theory proof or discussion articles/blogs.       ==== ðŸ“ˆ Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're improving the performance, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [ ] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.      ==== ðŸ†• Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're adding a new feature, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->  - [x] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).   This PR optimize the following things by using the new feature of GitHub Actions "rerun failed jobs"  - Bring all common dependencies (like build tar, build docker, sanity check, etc.) of UT, IT, E2E together and only execute them once. - Minimize the dependency tree, so when a job failed, we can rerun it and its dependents with minimal resources / time.  The dependency graph looks like this     This PR also fixes a problem that cancelled jobs can pass the "Required" CI check context.

Closes . - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).  Since JDK16, JDK requires `--add-opens java.base/java.lang=ALL-UNNAMED` to work. In this change, I add a version sensitive mechanism to adopt different Javassist API to avoid this break. Meanwhile, OAL engine doesn't support OALDefine to override the package name. All classes are generated in default packages only.  Relate to https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/7943.

column3: Revert #8066 introduced in 8.9.0
column4: ` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. , .     Put an `x` in the `[ ]` to mark the item as CHECKED. `[x]` -->   - [ ] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works. - [ ] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.      ==== ðŸ› Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're fixing a bug, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] Add a benchmark for the improvement, refer to [the existing ones](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/apm-commons/apm-datacarrier/src/test/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/commons/datacarrier/LinkedArrayBenchmark.java) - [ ] The benchmark result. ```text  ``` - [ ] Links/URLs to the theory proof or discussion articles/blogs.       ==== ðŸ“ˆ Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're improving the performance, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [ ] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.      ==== ðŸ†• Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're adding a new feature, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/changes/changes.md).  Revert the following changes in 8.9.0's PR #8066 ____ Optimize metrics of minute dimensionality persistence. - The value of metrics, which has declaration of the default value and current value equals the default value logically, the whole row wouldn't be pushed into database. - Add self-observability `metrics_persistence_skipped` metric to measure the number of skipped metrics. - SLA(percent function), Apdex, AvgLong(MAL mostly) metrics are mostly optimized because of this. Such as a full-failing error(0% successful rate) and unhealthy(apdex=0) are not costing the storage. - Hour/Day dimensionalities metrics are not changed, as they cover long duration. - Fix `max` function in OAL doesn't support negative long. ____  This optimization makes a side-effect, reported by @toffentoffen, the typical use case is shown in the demo env. ![Screenshot 2022-07-12 at 11 39 11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/178534028-137a9494-f9cf-4d92-9d47-35c7c45e261d.png)  This service has only 66% success rate, but when you read the endpoint success rate list(DESC order), you can only see all are 100%. This is very confusing.  **The root cause** is the above optimization, if an entity(in this case, an endpoint)'s success rate is 0%, the metric is not persistent. Then when we do topN aggregation query, there is no available data to list, even its success rate is pretty low. Meanwhile, if you query in hour/day level, it would show up, which makes ppl more confusing.  So, to keep things simpler, and as the success rate is the only metric that could be optimized through this PR, I am going to revert this optimization, and keep all aggregated metrics in the storage consistently.

column3: Fix unexpected deleting due to TTL mechanism bug
column4: ` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. , .     Put an `x` in the `[ ]` to mark the item as CHECKED. `[x]` -->   - [ ] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works. - [ ] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.      ==== ðŸ› Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're fixing a bug, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] Add a benchmark for the improvement, refer to [the existing ones](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/apm-commons/apm-datacarrier/src/test/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/commons/datacarrier/LinkedArrayBenchmark.java) - [ ] The benchmark result. ```text  ``` - [ ] Links/URLs to the theory proof or discussion articles/blogs.       ==== ðŸ“ˆ Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're improving the performance, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [ ] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.      ==== ðŸ†• Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're adding a new feature, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).   Fix unexpected deleting due to TTL mechanism bug for H2, MySQL, TiDB and PostgreSQL. Need to set up the lower limit for TTL deleting SQLs. Otherwise, the minute level deleting statement, could easily remove day and hour mertrics, because `yyyyMMddHH` < `yyyyMMddHHmm` is always true.  We set the lower limit according to the precision, then make sure the mis-deleting would not happen.

Now we could use OAL script like this  ``` // Calculate the CPM with the GET method for each service.The value is made up with `tagKey:tagValue`. // Option 1, use `tags contain`. service_cpm_http_get = from(Service.*).filter(tags contain "http.method:GET").cpm() // Option 2, use `tag[key]`. service_cpm_http_get = from(Service.*).filter(tag["http.method"] == "GET").cpm(); ```

column3: Support `(str->long)` and `(str->int)` cast statements in OAL core engine.
column4: ` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. , .     Put an `x` in the `[ ]` to mark the item as CHECKED. `[x]` -->   - [ ] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works. - [ ] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.      ==== ðŸ› Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're fixing a bug, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] Add a benchmark for the improvement, refer to [the existing ones](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/apm-commons/apm-datacarrier/src/test/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/commons/datacarrier/LinkedArrayBenchmark.java) - [ ] The benchmark result. ```text  ``` - [ ] Links/URLs to the theory proof or discussion articles/blogs.       ==== ðŸ“ˆ Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're improving the performance, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [ ] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.      ==== ðŸ†• Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're adding a new feature, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).  Step 2 of https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/7828.   Enhance OAL engine core * Fix `funcParamExpression` and `literalExpression` can't be used in the same aggregation function. * Support cast statement in the OAL core engine. * Support `(str->long)` and `(long)` for string to long cast statement. * Support `(str->int)` and `(int)` for string to int cast statement. * Support Long literal number in the OAL core engine. * Support literal `string` as parameter of aggregation function. * Add `attributeExpression` and `attributeExpressionSegment` in the OAL grammar tree to support `map` type for the   attribute expression.  Besides added UTs, I locally added this OAL script ``` mq_consume_latency = from((str->long)Service.tag["transmission.latency"]).longAvg();  mq_consume_latency = from((long)Service.tag["transmission.latency"]).longAvg(); ```  In OAL debug mode(`SW_OAL_ENGINE_DEBUG=Y`), I can see this method generated in the dispatcher ```java     private void doMqConsumeLatency(Service var1) {         MqConsumeLatencyMetrics var2 = new MqConsumeLatencyMetrics();         var2.setTimeBucket(var1.getTimeBucket());         var2.setEntityId(var1.getEntityId());         var2.combine(Long.parseLong(var1.getTag("transmission.latency")), (long)1);         MetricsStreamProcessor.getInstance().in(var2);     } ```  Another test in filter expression. ``` mq_consume_latency = from((str->long)Service.tag["transmission.latency"]).filter((str->long)tag["transmission.latency"] > 0L).longAvg(); ``` ```     private void doMqConsumeLatency(Service var1) {         if ((new GreaterMatch()).match(Long.parseLong(var1.getTag("transmission.latency")), 0L)) {             MqConsumeLatencyMetrics var2 = new MqConsumeLatencyMetrics();             var2.setTimeBucket(var1.getTimeBucket());             var2.setEntityId(var1.getEntityId());             var2.combine(Long.parseLong(var1.getTag("transmission.latency")), (long)1);             MetricsStreamProcessor.getInstance().in(var2);         }     } ```

column3: [Cancelled] Revert IoTDB as storage option due to negative perf testing result.
column4: ` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. , .     Put an `x` in the `[ ]` to mark the item as CHECKED. `[x]` -->   - [ ] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works. - [ ] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.      ==== ðŸ› Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're fixing a bug, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] Add a benchmark for the improvement, refer to [the existing ones](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/apm-commons/apm-datacarrier/src/test/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/commons/datacarrier/LinkedArrayBenchmark.java) - [ ] The benchmark result. ```text  ``` - [ ] Links/URLs to the theory proof or discussion articles/blogs.       ==== ðŸ“ˆ Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're improving the performance, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [ ] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.      ==== ðŸ†• Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're adding a new feature, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).  Revert #7766. I am so sorry @LIU-WEI-git @jixuan1989 I have to initialize this **revert** due to our recent performance testing result.  Here are the graphs of SkyWalking OAP server so11y(self-obsevability) result. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/143798527-5e0f38a7-379b-4d03-8f38-38b901ad57d2.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/143798529-6eb48e02-38f8-481e-a148-59c77eec26a6.png)  Before 9:45, the OAP includes the pull request of IoTDB storage implementation, you can see that, it provides much lower performance than it should be(after 9:45). The analysis capability drops from `30+k/s` to `< 10k/s`, which is hard to believe.  Both of these testing are running in new deployed environment, most importantly, IoTDB storage option is even **NEVER ACTIVATED**, which could only provide one possibility, the packages(jars) we introduced have clear conflicts and performance impact to SkyWalking server.  This is the first time I see this happened, which surprised me too. But tests verified this repeatedly. So I am submitting this pull request, and will ask @mrproliu to verify again according this branch.

column3: Optimize metrics of minute dimensionality persistence, don't save metric of being default value.
column4: ` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. , .     Put an `x` in the `[ ]` to mark the item as CHECKED. `[x]` -->   - [ ] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works. - [ ] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.      ==== ðŸ› Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're fixing a bug, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] Add a benchmark for the improvement, refer to [the existing ones](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/apm-commons/apm-datacarrier/src/test/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/commons/datacarrier/LinkedArrayBenchmark.java) - [ ] The benchmark result. ```text  ``` - [ ] Links/URLs to the theory proof or discussion articles/blogs.       ==== ðŸ“ˆ Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're improving the performance, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [ ] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.      ==== ðŸ†• Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're adding a new feature, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).  Optimize metrics of minute dimensionality persistence. - The value of metrics, which has declaration of the default value and current value equals the default value logically, the whole row wouldn't be pushed into database. - Add self-observability `metrics_persistence_skipped` metric to measure the number of skipped metrics. - SLA(percent function), Apdex, AvgLong(MAL mostly) metrics are mostly optimized because of this. Such as a full-failing error(0% successful rate) and unhealthy(apdex=0) are not costing the storage. - Hour/Day dimensionalities metrics are not changed, as they cover long duration. - Fix `max` function in OAL doesn't support negative long.

Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).  Deprecate `All` from OAL source, according to latest layer concept, `All` as source has lost its meaning. We never would find a way to have scope=all metrics, as each layer is different from others.  @kezhenxu94 Event source is belong to `All`(a.k.a. default`) scope, because we don't set its `ScopeDeclaration#catalog`. Which scope or catalog should it belong?

Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).  All meter objects generated in MeterSystem don't implement `WithMetadata`, which could make the alarm kernel ignore all of them. So, I am now adding `Meter` as the root of all MeterFunction classes, and injecting the default implementations to adopt the alarm kernel.  I am asking a community user to test, and am not sure whether this is good enough.

column4: ` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. , .     Put an `x` in the `[ ]` to mark the item as CHECKED. `[x]` -->   - [ ] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works. - [ ] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.      ==== ðŸ› Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're fixing a bug, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] Add a benchmark for the improvement, refer to [the existing ones](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/apm-commons/apm-datacarrier/src/test/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/commons/datacarrier/LinkedArrayBenchmark.java) - [ ] The benchmark result. ```text  ``` - [ ] Links/URLs to the theory proof or discussion articles/blogs.       ==== ðŸ“ˆ Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're improving the performance, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [ ] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.      ==== ðŸ†• Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're adding a new feature, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).  According to [ASF official post](https://blogs.apache.org/foundation/entry/apache-log4j-cves), **fix in Log4j 2.15.0 was incomplete in some non-default configurations and could allow an attacker to execute a denial of service (DoS) attack.**  DoS is not a common case SkyWalking would face, so, I would only put it in the master branch for next(9.0) release.

This is never used, so, no one reported. But using `_` to build hash code is definite a bug.

column3: Enhance DataCarrier#MultipleChannelsConsumer to add priority
column4: ` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. , .     Put an `x` in the `[ ]` to mark the item as CHECKED. `[x]` -->   - [ ] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works. - [ ] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.      ==== ðŸ› Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're fixing a bug, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] Add a benchmark for the improvement, refer to [the existing ones](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/apm-commons/apm-datacarrier/src/test/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/commons/datacarrier/LinkedArrayBenchmark.java) - [ ] The benchmark result. ```text  ``` - [ ] Links/URLs to the theory proof or discussion articles/blogs.       ==== ðŸ“ˆ Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're improving the performance, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [ ] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.      ==== ðŸ†• Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're adding a new feature, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).  * Enhance DataCarrier#MultipleChannelsConsumer to add priority for the channels, which makes OAP server has a better   performance to activate all analyzers on default. * Activate `receiver-otel#enabledOcRules` receiver with `k8s-cluster,k8s-node,k8s-service,oap,vm` rules on default. * Activate `satellite,spring-sleuth` for `agent-analyzer#meterAnalyzerActiveFiles`  on default. * Activate `receiver-zabbix` receiver with `agent` rule on default.  @wankai123 @mrproliu @kezhenxu94 As a result, many rules are being activated on default, also for the latest UI, all metrics would be visible on the configuration page(FYI @Fine0830).  For the end-users, they don't need to change deployment, reboot the OAP server, or face confused status.  ``` * Priority determines the consuming strategy. On default every period consumer thread loops all groups trying * to fetch the data from queue, if the queue only contains few elements, it is too expensive to consume every * time. * * if 'size of last fetched data' > 0 * * priority = 'size of last fetched data' * 100 / {@link Channels#size()} * {@link Channels#getChannelSize()} * * else * * priority = priority / 2 * * Meaning, priority is the load factor of {@link #channels} * * After consuming loop, priority = (priority of current loop + priority of last loop) / 2. * * If priority > 50, consuming happens in next loop, otherwise, priority += 10, and wait until priority > 50. In * worth case, for a low traffic group, consuming happens in 1/10. ```

column3: Add `Column.shardingKeyIdx` for column definition for BanyanDB
column4: ` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. , .     Put an `x` in the `[ ]` to mark the item as CHECKED. `[x]` -->   - [ ] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works. - [ ] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.      ==== ðŸ› Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're fixing a bug, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] Add a benchmark for the improvement, refer to [the existing ones](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/apm-commons/apm-datacarrier/src/test/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/commons/datacarrier/LinkedArrayBenchmark.java) - [ ] The benchmark result. ```text  ``` - [ ] Links/URLs to the theory proof or discussion articles/blogs.       ==== ðŸ“ˆ Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're improving the performance, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [ ] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.      ==== ðŸ†• Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're adding a new feature, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).  * Add `Column.shardingKeyIdx` for column definition for BanyanDB.  ``` Sharding key is used to group time series data per metric of one entity in one place (same sharding or same  column for column-oriented database). For example, ServiceA's traffic gauge, service call per minute, includes following timestamp values, then it should be sharded by service ID [ServiceA(encoded ID): 01-28 18:30 values-1, 01-28 18:31 values-2, 01-28 18:32 values-3, 01-28 18:32 values-4]  BanyanDB is the 1st storage implementation supporting this. It would make continuous time series metrics stored closely and compressed better.  NOTICE, this sharding concept is NOT just for splitting data into different database instances or physical files. ```  * Add `JD_PRESERVE_LINE_FEEDS=true` in official code style file. Then our comments don't have to use many blank lines to keep format.

column3: Enhance endpoint dependency analysis to support cross threads cases.
column4: ` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. , .     Put an `x` in the `[ ]` to mark the item as CHECKED. `[x]` -->   - [ ] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works. - [ ] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.      ==== ðŸ› Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're fixing a bug, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] Add a benchmark for the improvement, refer to [the existing ones](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/apm-commons/apm-datacarrier/src/test/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/commons/datacarrier/LinkedArrayBenchmark.java) - [ ] The benchmark result. ```text  ``` - [ ] Links/URLs to the theory proof or discussion articles/blogs.       ==== ðŸ“ˆ Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're improving the performance, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [ ] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.      ==== ðŸ†• Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're adding a new feature, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).   * [**Breaking Change**] Remove **Deprecated responseCode** from sources, including Service, ServiceInstance, Endpoint * Enhance endpoint dependency analysis to support cross threads cases. Refactor span analysis code structures.  ___  In our showcase and Java agent scenarios, there are several cross-thread tracing cases, we were not generating endpoint dependency if ref exists in local and exit span. In this PR, I am adding this missing part back. Also, in case the downstream endpoint of the dependency is another local/exit span's operation name, which was not generating endpoint traffic before, I add traffic generation of both sides' endpoints of dependency. Another important point that drives me to fix this is, in the new Booster UI, metrics of endpoint dependency are shown in a separate dashboard, which requires the endpoints of both sides existing in meta data, otherwise, nothing shows up.  For e2e, I updated the Java agent to the latest.  @kezhenxu94 @wankai123  Please verify this would enhance the endpoint dependency on the showcase.

column3: [Critical] Fix the priority mechanism of DataCarrier's MultipleChannelsConsumer failure.
column4: ` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. , .     Put an `x` in the `[ ]` to mark the item as CHECKED. `[x]` -->   - [ ] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works. - [ ] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.      ==== ðŸ› Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're fixing a bug, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] Add a benchmark for the improvement, refer to [the existing ones](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/apm-commons/apm-datacarrier/src/test/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/commons/datacarrier/LinkedArrayBenchmark.java) - [ ] The benchmark result. ```text  ``` - [ ] Links/URLs to the theory proof or discussion articles/blogs.       ==== ðŸ“ˆ Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're improving the performance, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [ ] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.      ==== ðŸ†• Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're adding a new feature, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/changelog/docs/en/changes/changes.md).  @kezhenxu94 Reported this bug to us, and noticed https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/8664 applied into the mainstream, the OAP server could report gRPC thread pool is full, rejecting the task, even the traffic is very low, and ElasticSearch is healthy, once #8664 is reverted, the error is gone in the same test scenario.  I did some research about my last change, and found out this bug only could occur when traffic is low. I was using `channels.getChannelSize() * channels.size()`, and I thought it is the size, and actually `channels.size()` is the size already. So with this wrong usage, the priority is always very low, and hard(maybe never?) to reach over 50. Then the queue is full with a very low priority, not consuming anymore.  The fix is easy, make the priority back to expected value.

Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/changelog/docs/en/changes/changes.md).   According to https://grpc.github.io/grpc-java/javadoc/io/grpc/stub/StreamObserver.html#onError-java.lang.Throwable-  > (`onError`) May only be called once and if called it must be the last method called. In particular if an exception is thrown by an implementation of onError no further calls to any method are allowed.  This will cause warning logs:  ``` WARNING: Cancelling the stream with status Status{code=INTERNAL, description=Completed without a response, cause=null} ```

With all these years, we are listed in many places by different foundations, orgs, and vendors.  I am feeling it is hard to tell which should be listed, so, let's remove all and make the readme include community channels and project information only.

column3: Only report `bug warning` in precise conditions.
column4: ` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. , .     Put an `x` in the `[ ]` to mark the item as CHECKED. `[x]` -->   - [ ] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works. - [ ] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.      ==== ðŸ› Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're fixing a bug, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] Add a benchmark for the improvement, refer to [the existing ones](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/apm-commons/apm-datacarrier/src/test/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/commons/datacarrier/LinkedArrayBenchmark.java) - [ ] The benchmark result. ```text  ``` - [ ] Links/URLs to the theory proof or discussion articles/blogs.       ==== ðŸ“ˆ Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're improving the performance, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [ ] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.      ==== ðŸ†• Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're adding a new feature, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [ ] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).  User will see the `[Bug warning]` in 2 typical cases 1. If the template exists and index deleted, or in reverse. In this case, this isn't the bug report we expected. 2. OAP shut down over a day and latest index doesn't exist for sure. In this case, we just need to return false, and `create` method will fix this.

Closes #. - [ ] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).  A request for Sonatype Lift was to remove the THREAD_SAFETY_VIOLATION violation appearing in PRs. This PR adds a configuration setting to stop the comments appearing in future PR's.  An example on demand run without the setting showing the THREAD_SAFETY_VIOLATION https://lift.sonatype.com/results/github.com/apache/skywalking/01FYY2QG9P3AC8AYBFANRH7ZZ7?t=Infer%7CTHREAD_SAFETY_VIOLATION  An example on demand run using this setting https://lift.sonatype.com/results/github.com/doddi/skywalking/01FYY8BBCACQ1W0HNQ9HWDBNWS (running from this branch)

column3: Fix `Hour`/`Day` dimensionality metrics and `Slow SQL sampling` are not accurate
column4: ` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. , .     Put an `x` in the `[ ]` to mark the item as CHECKED. `[x]` -->   - [ ] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works. - [ ] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.      ==== ðŸ› Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're fixing a bug, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] Add a benchmark for the improvement, refer to [the existing ones](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/apm-commons/apm-datacarrier/src/test/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/commons/datacarrier/LinkedArrayBenchmark.java) - [ ] The benchmark result. ```text  ``` - [ ] Links/URLs to the theory proof or discussion articles/blogs.       ==== ðŸ“ˆ Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're improving the performance, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [ ] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.      ==== ðŸ†• Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're adding a new feature, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [ ] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).  * Fix `Hour` and `Day` dimensionality metrics not accurate, due to the cache read-then-clear mechanism conflicts with low   down metrics flush period added in 8.7.0. * Fix `Slow SQL sampling` not accurate, due to TopN works conflict with cache read-then-clear mechanism. * The persistent cache is only read when necessary.

column3: Fix the configuration of `Aggregation`  and `GC Count` metrics for oap self observability(#8707)
column4: ` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. , .     Put an `x` in the `[ ]` to mark the item as CHECKED. `[x]` -->  ### Fix  - [x] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.   - [ ] Add a benchmark for the improvement, refer to [the existing ones](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/apm-commons/apm-datacarrier/src/test/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/commons/datacarrier/LinkedArrayBenchmark.java) - [ ] The benchmark result. ```text  ``` - [ ] Links/URLs to the theory proof or discussion articles/blogs.       ==== ðŸ“ˆ Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're improving the performance, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [ ] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.      ==== ðŸ†• Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're adding a new feature, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->  - [x] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #8707 . - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).  **The Reason:**  The sum method loses the dimension label. When there are multiple metrics generated from the same child metric using increase method after sum. the value of the metrics will be miscalculated.  **How to Fix:** - Delete the multiple metrics that generate from the same child metric - Create a new metric, add the dimension label in sum method, change the tag of the new metric if needed. - Fetch the new metric in the way of labeled value type.

When there are multiple metrics generated from the same child metric using increase method after sum. the value of the metrics will be miscalculated.  **How to Fix.**   1. Fetch the new metric in the way of labeled value type.

column3: Upgrade Apache Parent version to 25
column4: 1: We can see the difference in several versions here. https://maven.apache.org/pom-archives/asf-LATEST/#history 2: The docs plugin is set to default to Java 1.7, so I modified it.  - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).

column3: Support eBPF Profiling E2E
column4: 1. Support the eBPF Profiling E2E 2. Fix the query in the storage 3. Combine trace profiling with eBPF profiling E2E under one directory.  4. Let `multiGet` could query without tag value in the `InfluxDB` storage plugin, it could help on the eBPF Profiling GraphQL query.   - [x] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).

column3: Bump up iotdb-session to 0.12.4 and fix IoTDB storage option bug
column4: 1. Fix IoTDB Storage Option insert null index value. 2. Set the default value of SW_STORAGE_IOTDB_SESSIONPOOL_SIZE to 8. If it's 0, the SessionPool size will be 2 * CPU_Cores 3. Bump up iotdb-session to 0.12.4  - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).

column3: Documentation grammar enhancements
column4: - Removed the empty `CHANGES.md` at root. - Enhance grammar of docs in the setup sections. ` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. , .     Put an `x` in the `[ ]` to mark the item as CHECKED. `[x]` -->   - [ ] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works. - [ ] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.      ==== ðŸ› Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're fixing a bug, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] Add a benchmark for the improvement, refer to [the existing ones](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/apm-commons/apm-datacarrier/src/test/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/commons/datacarrier/LinkedArrayBenchmark.java) - [ ] The benchmark result. ```text  ``` - [ ] Links/URLs to the theory proof or discussion articles/blogs.       ==== ðŸ“ˆ Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're improving the performance, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->   - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [ ] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.      ==== ðŸ†• Remove this line WHEN AND ONLY WHEN you're adding a new feature, follow the checklist ðŸ‘† ==== -->  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [ ] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/changelog/docs/en/changes/changes.md).

column3: Add MicroBench module to make it easier for developers to write JMH Test
column4: - [x] Closes #7910  - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).  Writing the benchmark itself is not hard, but getting it right is. Thankfully, the JMH suite provides helpful annotations and features to mitigate most of them. To get started, you need to make your benchmark extend the AbstractMicrobenchmark, which makes sure the test gets run through JUnit and configures some defaults: ``` @BenchmarkMode({Mode.Throughput}) public class LinkedArrayBenchmark extends AbstractMicrobenchmark { } ```  For most benchmark tests, you can write it as a normal JUnit. You can also choose Customizing Runtime Conditions.  At present, you can run all JMH Tests by running the jar directly after packaging. But running all JMH directly through mvn and showing that the overall report still has some problems, you can first see if it is reasonable.

column3: e2e-v2: Simplified cluster e2e to reduce failure
column4: - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Cluster e2e failing frequently, due to the sometimes consumer request can't be dispatched to both provider1 and provider2. column3: Implement the eBPF profiling query and data collect protocol
column4: * Implement the eBPF profiling query and data collect protocol * Migrate existing profile classes to the profiling package * I will submit a new PR after rover side finished for E2E testing  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).  ### Profiling Data Merging Benchmark We have three types of data sources, all of the benchmarks are only merging data without query. |Name|Report Period|Dump Duration|Merge Instance Count|Stack Depth Range|Stack Duplicate Rate(%)|Stack Symbol Duplicate Rate(%)| |---|----|----|---|---|---|---| |LowDatasource|5s|60m|10|15,30|5|100,40,35,30,15,10,7,5| |MedianDatasource|5s|100m|200|15,30|3|50,40,35,30,20,10,7,5,2| |HighDatasource|5s|2h|2000|15,40|1|30,27,25,20,17,15,10,7,5,2,1|  ``` Benchmark                                                Mode  Cnt     Score    Error  Units EBPFProfilingAnalyzerBenchmark.analyzeLowDataSource     thrpt   20  2134.237 Â± 33.583  ops/s EBPFProfilingAnalyzerBenchmark.analyzeMaxDataSource     thrpt   20     6.128 Â±  0.149  ops/s EBPFProfilingAnalyzerBenchmark.analyzeMedianDataSource  thrpt   20    97.159 Â±  3.105  ops/s ```  ### GraphQL Screenshot ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3417650/158754617-13a959d9-97cb-424f-b833-13df57231b48.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3417650/158754648-76f76175-2896-43f3-aee1-fb527f49ff6b.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3417650/158754687-ec4d9995-36cc-48cb-99f0-e5e2def5fab4.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3417650/158754710-880ede2e-9906-4a76-949a-8d775d22f83c.png)

column3: Support ElasticSearch template mappings `properties parameters` and `_source` update
column4: ### Support ElasticSearch template mappings `properties parameters` and `_source` update - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [X] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Previous logic can't update the mappings `properties parameters` and `_source` only support adding a new property. ### Now 1. As the OAP core merges the index of metrics, properties would not be deleted still. 2. Would not update the current index to avoid conflict, a new index follows the new template to create.

Closes #. - [X] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).

column3: [Website] Documentation search engine not picking up latest docs
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar issues.   ### Apache SkyWalking Component  Website (apache/skywalking-website)  ### What happened  Sorry if this goes into the wrong category. I just found out that the recent docs (including OAP > 8.7.0-8.9.1 & Python agent entirely etc.) were not picked up by the Algolia search engine at all.  Now searching for keywords within those docs either returns nothing or results from other repos, which is quite confusing.  The config file was hosted in the Algolia [repo](https://github.com/algolia/docsearch-configs/blob/master/configs/skywalking.json), which happened to be deprecated and now requires configuration through a [web interface](https://crawler.algolia.com/) that I don't have access to.    FYI @Jtrust, as you added the previous configs through GitHub.  ### What you expected to happen  Versioned doc pages should yield corresponding search results when using the top right search box.   ### How to reproduce  1. Search within [Java agent: v8.9.0](https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/skywalking-java/v8.9.0/readme/) returns nothing. 2. Search within [Python agent: latest](https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/skywalking-python/latest/readme/) only returns results from OAP docs, while v0.7.0 gives nothing  ### Anything else  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Bug] No Data in UI when time range is bigger than one hour
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar issues.   ### Apache SkyWalking Component  UI (apache/skywalking-rocketbot-ui)  ### What happened  I'm running skywalking 8.8.1 using docker compose as described in https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docker . I'm using postgres 11.3 as backend storage.    After selecting a time range bigger than one hour every diagrams get null values.  Example:  time range 58 min  ![immagine](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70517698/144879286-87755842-6267-4d8c-a910-342354f4aeb0.png)  time range 1h 18min  ![immagine](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70517698/144882846-98dfed65-77f0-4052-b3b7-0abd33424367.png)  When the log level is on INFO I can't get any useful information reading backend logs    ### What you expected to happen  I expect to have information on the whole period I select   ### How to reproduce  Start a skywalking server, ui version 8.8.1 with docker ( https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docker ) and postgres as backend.  Open the UI -> Select a time range bigger than one hour   ### Anything else  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Bug] Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Cannot read property 'getAllTemplates' of undefined
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar issues.   ### Apache SkyWalking Component  UI (apache/skywalking-booster-ui)  ### What happened version: 8.9.1 The interface does not display any information. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15009808/162163424-0e6889bb-cfb9-4e04-a706-12aba93f7a90.png)  I think it's a front-end problem.  Browser console error messageï¼š `app.f4e7af01.js:1 Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Cannot read property 'getAllTemplates' of undefined` ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15009808/162163918-f90f36de-6ea4-4e20-a4a4-3140528f99ac.png)   Browser response: We're sorry but SkyWalking doesn't work properly without JavaScript enabled. Please enable it to continue. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15009808/162163844-fb842e19-f943-4d03-b0f9-2fc14c3ad399.png)  agent data is sent to oap normallyï¼š skywalking-api.log: `DataCarrier.DEFAULT.Consumer.0.Thread TraceSegmentServiceClient : 1 trace segments have been sent to collector.`  But there is no problem with the non-container installation method.   ### What you expected to happen   The interface can be displayed normally.    ### How to reproduce  Install skywalking by docker-compose, please refer to the attached yml file. [docker-compose.devops.latest.yml.zip](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/files/8441414/docker-compose.devops.latest.yml.zip)   ### Anything else  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Bug]
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar issues.   ### Apache SkyWalking Component  UI (apache/skywalking-booster-ui)  ### What happened  with v9 ui, in general dashboard, when pick a end date on the navbar, will set the start date with same value at same time, and cause a series of query error  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7851881/172823745-85818863-cc6c-4469-80ad-9b8a1772a7e2.png)   ### What you expected to happen  should only set the end date.     ### How to reproduce  - General Service - click any service to get General Dashboard - Navbar, right top, pick any end date  ### Anything else  Not really familiar with VueJS, has check the source code,   - TimePicker.vue - setDates() emit twice, one with positon right, one without as position is undified, thus further set the start date - tricky walkround, double check left position ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7851881/172824820-d80d3a22-9a2e-4c1e-8572-ee47d5f1fb32.png)  ### Are you willing to submit PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Bug] UI docker image start failed
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar issues.   ### Apache SkyWalking Component  UI (apache/skywalking-booster-ui)  ### What happened  Use below Dockerfile to build a new image and publish to k8s ``` FROM apache/skywalking-ui:9.0.0  ENV SW_OAP_ADDRESS=http://oap.bruce.io:12800  EXPOSE 8080 ENTRYPOINT ["/skywalking/docker-entrypoint.sh"] ```  The flowing errors were displayed in the log and the pod restarted times by times _libcontainer: container start initialization failed: standard_init_linux.go:224: exec user process caused "exec format error_  ### What you expected to happen  New docker container should start normally and can be accessed from the browser.  ### How to reproduce  Run the Dockerfile.  ### Anything else  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Bug] [UI] Refresh and auto-refresh don't keep the select entity
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar issues.   ### Apache SkyWalking Component  UI (apache/skywalking-booster-ui)  ### What happened  The service/instance/endpoint on the top selectors are back to the 1st one, if manual or auto refresh is triggered.  ### What you expected to happen  We should keep them in both manual and auto refresh cases.  ### How to reproduce  - Manual(client refresh)    - Open auto-refresh settings    One more relative issue, the `Auto` button seems lost the current status(opened) when open the page again.  ### Anything else  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Bug] The current page number does not change if total page size is less than the current page number after a new query in trace page
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar issues.   ### Apache SkyWalking Component  UI (apache/skywalking-booster-ui)  ### What happened  The current page number does not change if total page size is less than the current page number after a new query in trace page in verion v8.9.1  ### What you expected to happen  Maybe it's better to set the current page number to 1 if total page size is less than the current page number after a new query in trace page.  ### How to reproduce  1.Search with a wider filter and get a result with relative large total page size 2.navigate to a certain page, such as 10 3.narrow down the filter, and ensure the result total page size is less than the page we navigated to in step 2. 4.we get the first page data for the new query, how ever the current page numer remain with the numer we navigated in step 2.   ### Anything else  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit PR?  - [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: Trace page auto-freshing bahaviour
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar issues.   ### Apache SkyWalking Component  UI (apache/skywalking-booster-ui)  ### What happened  After skywalking 9.1.0 turns on auto refresh, the trace page automatically refreshes every few seconds. Even after auto refresh is turned off, the trace page still automatically refreshes every few seconds. The trace pages of versions before 9.0 are not affected by auto refreshã€‚  ### What you expected to happen  Trace pages are not affected by automatic refresh.  ### How to reproduce  http://demo.skywalking.apache.org/general  In the official example, turn on automatic refresh to observe the trace page, and then turn off automatic refresh to observe the trace page.  ### Anything else  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Bug] SWCK 0.5.0 start failed with error "no matches for kind Ingress in version networking.k8s.io/v1" before k8s v1.18
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar issues.   ### Apache SkyWalking Component  SWCK (apache/skywalking-swck)  ### What happened  Environment:  k8s version: 1.14.8 and 1.16.9 SWCK version: 0.5.0  Question: When we deploy SWCK 0.5.0 in k8s v1.14.8 and v1.16.9, the swck-controller-manager pod start failed and crash with the error "no matches for kind Ingress in version networking.k8s.io/v1". I also try this in other k8s verisons and find that the same problem was encountered before version v1.18.9 (included)ã€‚NOTEï¼šSWCK 0.4.0 can work well in k8s v1.14.8+.  The log of the swck-controller-manager pod is as follows: ``` kubectl -n skywalking-swck-system logs -p  --tail 20 skywalking-swck-controller-manager-6c88fbd7b6-tr982  --------------------------------------------------------   2022-01-01T10:02:16.775Z        INFO    controller.fetcher      Starting workers        {"reconciler group": "operator.skywalking.apache.org", "reconciler kind": "Fetcher", "worker count": 1} 2022-01-01T10:02:16.775Z        ERROR   controller.ui   Could not wait for Cache to sync        {"reconciler group": "operator.skywalking.apache.org", "reconciler kind": "UI", "error": "failed to wait for ui caches to sync: no matches for kind \"Ingress\" in version \"networking.k8s.io/v1\""} sigs.k8s.io/controller-runtime/pkg/internal/controller.(*Controller).Start         /home/gao/go/pkg/mod/sigs.k8s.io/controller-runtime@v0.10.0/pkg/internal/controller/controller.go:234 sigs.k8s.io/controller-runtime/pkg/manager.(*controllerManager).startRunnable.func1         /home/gao/go/pkg/mod/sigs.k8s.io/controller-runtime@v0.10.0/pkg/manager/internal.go:696 2022-01-01T10:02:16.775Z        INFO    controller.storage      Starting workers        {"reconciler group": "operator.skywalking.apache.org", "reconciler kind": "Storage", "worker count": 1} 2022-01-01T10:02:16.775Z        INFO    controller.oapserver    Starting workers        {"reconciler group": "operator.skywalking.apache.org", "reconciler kind": "OAPServer", "worker count": 1} 2022-01-01T10:02:16.775Z        INFO    controller.oapserver    Shutdown signal received, waiting for all workers to finish     {"reconciler group": "operator.skywalking.apache.org", "reconciler kind": "OAPServer"} 2022-01-01T10:02:16.775Z        INFO    controller.storage      Shutdown signal received, waiting for all workers to finish     {"reconciler group": "operator.skywalking.apache.org", "reconciler kind": "Storage"} 2022-01-01T10:02:16.775Z        INFO    controller.fetcher      Shutdown signal received, waiting for all workers to finish     {"reconciler group": "operator.skywalking.apache.org", "reconciler kind": "Fetcher"} 2022-01-01T10:02:16.775Z        INFO    controller.oapserver    All workers finished    {"reconciler group": "operator.skywalking.apache.org", "reconciler kind": "OAPServer"} 2022-01-01T10:02:16.775Z        INFO    controller.fetcher      All workers finished    {"reconciler group":
