column3: [Feature] [Java] OpenTracing APIs have deprecated
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  The OpenTracing project is deprecated. Please use [OpenTelemetry](https://opentelemetry.io/), which provides [backwards compatibility](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/blob/main/specification/compatibility/opentracing.md) with OpenTracing.  The above statement is from the official channel, https://opentracing.io/  ### Use case  OpenTracing bridge existed for years, but we don't have very positive user feedback. Most are using agent + our native SDK(APIs and annotations).  We should consider removing the OpenTracing bridge, evaluating the OpenTelemetry APIs, to see whether it is necessary to adopt them.  Eventually,  we need to remove the OpenTracing bridge as we never upgraded to the latest release due to not suitable anymore.  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] [Python] Remove namespace from `cross process propagation` key.
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  The namespace in `cross process propagation` key to isolating context was added years ago in Java agent and adopted by Python. Meanwhile, many other agents are not going to adopt. The key is there is few scenario to make services interact with each other but not be monitored by one APM. So, in https://github.com/apache/skywalking-java/pull/123, I am removing this feature and making namespace like today's general concept, the namespace of Kubernetes.   Since Java agent 8.10.0 **${service name} = [${group name}::]${logic name}|${NAMESPACE}|${CLUSTER}**  It is better Python agent could follow the same path. And it is better to be done before 1.0 release.  ### Use case  _No response_  ### Related issues  https://github.com/apache/skywalking-java/pull/123  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  The main motivations are: - Making full use of Java 8 Lambdas for writing easier to read tests and a better performing way of composing failure messages. - Improved test structures with nested and dynamic tests. - Much better support for parameterized tests to avoid separating parameterized and non-parameterized parts into different test classes. - Composable dependencies and better hooks for advanced use cases. - Better exception verification - More current infrastructure - Better parallelizable  ### Use case  _No response_  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  The Issue is to support the OAP's [dynamic configuration](https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/setup/backend/dynamic-config/) in SWCK.   The key design is to add a field in CRD `OAPServer` to indicate whether the dynamic configuration is required. If required, the `OAPServer Controller` needs to create a `Configmap` so that users can use the dynamic configuration through the `Configmap`.  ### Use case  _No response_  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Core] Cold writing
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  Support writing cold data whose timestamp is out of the current writing window.   The block controller tends to create cold blocks to collect these data instead of opening the closed blocks online. The scanner and fetcher of the series should look at cold blocks for handling querying tasks. column3: [Feature] [OAP] Support one StorageData persistence as more entities
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  SegmentRecord, AbstractLogRecord, and many entities have tags to query, which is hard to adopt in the relational database. So, right now, we use one table with multiple columns(tags), which has a very clear limitation with the tag value candidate.  @wankai123 and I have a discussion that, we should support multiple tables for one entity by using extra and new annotations.   Here are examples only     @wankai123 will make the final decision about how to implement this. Just a reminder, we may need to consider only 2 tables or multiple tables. (My example is only about 2 entities.   ### Use case  _No response_  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] add RocketMq consumer mq.topic tag
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  RocketMQ consumer segment don't contain `mq.topic` tag, so the UI trace page can not search consumer segment when input `mq.topic=TopicTest`  tag. I want to change RocketMQ agent, add `mq.topic` tag into consumer segment.  ### Use case  I checked the agent code and found consumer interceptor `AbstractMessageConsumeInterceptor` ``` @Override     public final void beforeMethod(EnhancedInstance objInst, Method method, Object[] allArguments,         Class[] argumentsTypes, MethodInterceptResult result) throws Throwable {         List msgs = (List) allArguments[0];          ContextCarrier contextCarrier = getContextCarrierFromMessage(msgs.get(0));         AbstractSpan span = ContextManager.createEntrySpan(CONSUMER_OPERATION_NAME_PREFIX + msgs.get(0)                                                                                                 .getTopic() + "/Consumer", contextCarrier);          span.setComponent(ComponentsDefine.ROCKET_MQ_CONSUMER);         SpanLayer.asMQ(span);         for (int i = 1; i < msgs.size(); i++) {             ContextManager.extract(getContextCarrierFromMessage(msgs.get(i)));         }      } ```  I add one line `Tags.MQ_TOPIC.set(span, msgs.get(0).getTopic());` after span created. I tested it on my local machine, it worked.  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] [E2E-INFRA] Request to make kind file configuration expandable with system environment
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  Request to make kind file configuration expandable with system environment.  ### Use case  E2E configuration sample:  ```yaml setup:   env: kind   file: common/kind-$K8S_VERSION.yaml ```  And there are several kind configurations in common folder:  ```bash common â”œâ”€â”€ kind-1.19.yaml â”œâ”€â”€ kind-1.20.yaml â”œâ”€â”€ kind-1.21.yaml â””â”€â”€ kind-1.22.yaml ```  Then, we could create a matrix E2E testing in GitHub Action, such as:  ```yaml jobs:   Install:     name: XYZ     runs-on: ubuntu-latest     timeout-minutes: 60     strategy:       matrix:         k8sVersion: ["1.19", "1.20", "1.21", "1.22"]     steps:       - uses: actions/checkout@v2       -        - name: Run E2E Test         uses: apache/skywalking-infra-e2e@feat/expand-env-for-kind-config-path         env:           K8S_VERSION: ${{ matrix.k8sVersion }}         with:           e2e-file: $GITHUB_WORKSPACE/test/e2e/cases/xyz/e2e.yaml ```  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] Support filtering data according to unindexed tags
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  OAP faces a use case that needs to find a log entry linked to a span in a segment according to segmentID+spanID. If we set up indices on both of them, the cardinalities of spanIDs are numerous in its index's posting list, leading to the crash of the database server by OOM.   The canonical path is to support filtering log entries by spanID, which is not indexed. The query module has to introduce filtering unindexed tags, AKA, "table scan". This feat doesn't break the API specification except for tweaking some documents.   ### Use case  _No response_  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] Tracing context propagation, from JDBC plugin to Database Proxy(ShardingSphere)
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  Now we use the [CyborgFlow](https://github.com/SphereEx/CyborgFlow) project to perform database switching and complete monitoring functions in the process of full-link stress testing, but we cannot yet complete the support for the topology map because there is currently no tracer at the database level. This issue is used to improve this part of the function. Mainly divided into two parts: 1. The agent transmits the Tracing Context to the database: puts comment into sql prefix. Multiple tracing context item are created as one comment, use "," to separate each item, and the key value in each item is separated by ".". The format is as follows: `/* sw8_context:base64_encode(item1_key).base64_encode(item1_value),base64_encode(item2_key).base64_encode(item2_value) */`. 2. The database analyzes the Trading Context: Currently [ShardingSphere](https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere) is willing to participate in it and participate in the development of the plug-in.  ### Use case  When the user uses the database (as a tracer) that SkyWalking supports to monitor, then we can observe the internal execution of the database in the topology diagram and link it with the application.  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  Inside one cluster, data synchronism is replication, which has been mentioned in https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/8501.  Here, I want to highlight we need the **Cross DataCenter/Cluster Data Synchronism** to make telemetry data could be shipped in different data centers. Such as in the target cluster, OAP works with a BanyanDB server(a) for analysis and monitoring, and another BanyanDB server could stand in another cluster accepting data synced from (a) server, and providing read-only query for the OPS team.  ### Use case  _No response_  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] [BanyanDB] Support function in row merging
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  In the MVP of BanyanDB, all rows would be overrides when the latest data was inserted with the same ID. In advanced, it is better BanyanDB could provide a function based merging mechanism to merge previous and new data. Based on this, SkyWalking OAP `L1->L2` distributed aggregation would not be necessary, and also would not require **reading metrics from DB before flushing back**, **maintaining session**.  ### Use case  This would highly advanced feature, which should not be considered in the first release. In longer-term, this would show much better performance as a native database.  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] [E2E-INFRA] Make skywalking-infra-e2e work with docker-compose V2
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  In the current `skywalking-e2e-infra` implementation, the logic of building container name is hard-coded with `_` as the separator. While using with `docker-compose` v2, it is incompatible,    https://github.com/docker/compose/blob/5becea4ca9f68875334c92f191a13482bcd6e5cf/compose/service.py#L1492-L1498  In the latest version (written in `go`), [`-` is used](https://github.com/docker/compose/blob/981aea674d052ee1ab252f71c3ca1f9f8a7e32de/pkg/compose/convergence.go#L252-L257). So the container created cannot be found, and thus the program exits unexpectedly.    A possible approach to solve this is to check `docker-compose` version in the `infra-e2e` and use different strategies for v1 and v2.  Another possible solution is to compare the container name by ignoring the difference between `_` and `-` .   ### Use case  Currently, docker-compose v1 is not under active maintenance.  We may support v2.  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Core] Stream data processing
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  In https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/6922, we accomplished most features of the trace module and other core components that support processing tracing data. We even did a banyandb java client for OAP.   Unfortunately, when I was implementing the index module, there was a defect in the original design that blocked us to make the trace feature happen.  Based on that, I set up this new issue to track current tasks.  Now we selected `Stream` as the official notion to ingest trace and log items. The `trace` module will be dropped once this transferring get done.  - [x] Upgrade API to v2. In v2, I introduce `stream` to substitute `trace` and tweak index relevant objects. - [x] Stream module. - [x] TSDB module. It's a time-series database engine to handle all of the data models. - [x] Several index packages. Including inverted index, tree(LSM-tree) index, term dictionary, and query execution tree. - [x] Prune outdated modules that are `trace`, `database`  and `index`. - [x] Query module. Adjust logical execution plan accordingly. (@lujiajing1126) - [x] Liaison. Adapt to the new stream protocols. - [x] Metadata empowered by embed Etcd. (@lujiajing1126)  - [x] Java client. Adapt to the new stream protocols. (@lujiajing1126) - [x] OAP storage layer https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/7412.(@lujiajing1126)  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] [BanyanDB Java Client] Support Sharding from cluster side.
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  In BanyanDB, we agree on supporting sharding-based cluster mode.  is not in the high priority on the server-side, because the only advantages of this are database runtime scaling, but it is too early to say so in a new database. Meanwhile, client-side sharding is not hard with the experience of building Apache ShardingSphere for years, and we have our native protocol and OAP all in control.  We should support static configuration-based sharding to work with multiple BanyanDB servers with each one of them having native replication. This feature could exist for long term until BanyanDB has its cluster mode(at least later than 0.3.0 server release, @hanahmily right?)  ### Use case  _No response_  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] Evaluate merging all metrics/meter indices into one physical entity in ElasticSearch
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  In an off-list discussion, I got some feedback from the community that, the size of the metrics index is still not big enough. A company uses 100G per shard policy, and the metrics index is using 2%-5% per shard, even after applying the function-based merging policy in v8.  So, I and @wankai123 are checking whether it is possible to merge more indices into one.  ### Use case  _No response_  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Satellite] Support partition pipeline
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  I'm working on the benchmark for satellite transmit the Enovy ALS message from Envoy to SkyWalking OAP. But I found that could only support 7K QPS for transmitting when receive the ALS is bigger than 7K, could not be kept growth. The Image is below. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3417650/140293427-21dc726b-0ed2-47dc-8eb0-c78941ccebb2.png)  Also, the satellite logs output the pipeline queue full and drop the received message. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3417650/140293525-90fd53ae-2349-4cdf-86ed-d2c8fdd6235e.png)   ### Use case  I found the satellite only has **one** sender(consumer) on each pipeline. It blocks the message written to the pipeline and wastes time on `I/O`.  So I think we could build the partitioned pipeline, then we could consume the pipeline parallel.   ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [python] [Feature] Add flexibility to 'peer' and 'op' label when using sw_rabbitmq and sw_requests
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  I would like to add options on how to name 'op' and 'peer' when using some of the plugins.  I have already written some code to address this feature and would like to make them part of the product for anyone to use.  Default would still be exactly the same as it is right now, but it would be possible to change the reporting behavior of the plugins for specific needs/services.  Right now, sw_rabbitmq uses: - peer => host:port - op => RabbitMQ/Topic/' + exchange + '/Queue/' + routing_key  I would like to add 2 env. variables to enable this change ( 1 bool + 1 label (Default RabbitMQ)): - peer => {env.var.label}: {exchange}: {routing_key}   Same goes for sw_requests: - peer => netloc - op => path or "/"  With 3 env. var (1 peer bool, 1 peer label (Default Web Request), 1 op bool): - peer => {label} - op => netloc  ### Use case  RabbitMQ: container 1 -> queue 1 -> container 2 -> queue 2 -> container 3  instead of: service 1 <-> RabbitMQ service 2 <-> RabbitMQ service  3 <- RabbitMQ   Requests: One of our containers calls different urls on the web to get additional information on the data being processed. This creates a crazy topology pointing to each and every webpage being read (tons of them)  We'd rather see: - service 1 -> Web Request  Instead of a storm like this: - service 1 -> url1, url2, url3, url4, url5..., url1000  Plus, in traces, we prefer seeing which websites are slow (netloc) than their precise path.  ### Related issues  There could be more of this coming in later as we start using Skywalking for all our services.   Just a question, I know this could be a big endeavor / change: - Did you plan on having some control over this type of labeling problem from the OAP Server instead of changing every plugin 1 by 1? - I've used AppDynamics and Dynatrace in the past and I really appreciated the possibility to change labels even after the applications went up. it gave APM people much faster results when they didn't have access to the service's configurations or restarts had to be approved.  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] [MAL Core] Add a match pattern mechanism for the MAL core
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  I noticed in the showcase(also demo env), we always face `oap::` services, which mean no actual service name. I finally got a chance to confirm with @kezhenxu94 why. It turns out `oap`'s self-observability and `vm`'s monitoring have the same metric name.  We need a mechanism to identify the source of a SampleFamily to avoid this case. I would like to propose these kind of mechanism.  We add a field precondition field into all MAL related configuration files, including `oc-receiver`, `envoy-metrics-receiver`, `meter-receiver` etc. This field should be a closure returning true/false. When `false` is returned, this SampleFamily set isn't pushed into rules of all including expressions, but simply skip.  @hanahmily Could you confirm this mechanism makes sense?  ### Use case  This feature could avoid empty service issue, and generally it increase the performance of MAL engine, because less calculation are applied by the input metrics set.  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  I hope SkyWalking OAP Server will add storage support and E2E testing for InfluxDB 2.x.  ### Use case  - I hope SkyWalking OAP Server will add storage support and E2E testing for `InfluxDB 2.x` . The current https://github.com/apache/skywalking/tree/master/test/e2e-v2/cases/storage/influxdb only has the E2E test of `InfluxDB 1.x`.   - At the same time, there are still some issues in the community indicating that the current `SkyWalking OAP Server` version  backend storage does not support `InfluxDB 2.x`, refer to https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/8163 . I hope `SkyWalking OAP Server` can add storage support for `InfluxDB 2.x` and E2E testing.   - The corresponding image is at https://hub.docker.com/_/influxdb .  ### Related issues  Yes, refer to https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/8163 .  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] python gRPC plugin
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  I have implemented a gRPC plugin for python, and interceptors([client-side](https://grpc.github.io/grpc/python/grpc.html#client-side-interceptor) and [server-side](https://grpc.github.io/grpc/python/grpc.html#service-side-interceptor)) were used to achieve this.   But in developer guide and plugins already implemented, it seems to be a different way to implement a plugin. > Inside the install method, you find out the relevant method(s) of the libraries that you plan to instrument, and create/close spans before/after those method(s).  I was wondering if I make a PR, is interceptors acceptable, or it is a better way to follow what's said in developer guide.  ### Use case  Use python gRPC plugin to track gRPC requests  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] Support Google Guava AsyncEventBus
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  Google guava `EventBus` is a component used to deliver distribution events in the process. When asynchronous distribution is used, trace will be lost, so I want to provide a plugin to support propagating trace information.  ### Use case  When use `com.google.common.eventbus.EventBus#post` method to dispatch a event, inject trace context to the event and extract in execution thread context.  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] Add version system and query for OAP server
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  From current status, SkyWalking OAP server will keep on 8.x release for months. It is better we are going to add version information in the final binary.  We are welcome anyone interesting to add this to SkyWalking.  ### Use case  Use `pom.xml`'s project version in the final package, and provide GraphQL query for UI to visualize this version number and other information, such as owner, license, package timestamp.  If the version is still `*-snapshot`, we could choose git commit(if exist) and sha code(of lib dir) to represent the version.  So, we should have following version styles. 1. Official release, `8.9.0`, `8.10,0` 2. Git dev binary, `8.9.0-SNAPSHOT-git-(commit id)`. 3. SHA dev binary, `8.9.0-SNAPSHOT-SHA-(sha code)`.  Also, SkyWalking booting starter should print the version and related information into the logs at the end of starting successfully.  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] query log count
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  Currently, you can query logs via `ILogQueryDAO` but you cannot just query log counts. I think we should add a parameter that indicates that only `Logs.total` should be populated. That way you can quickly get a feel for how many logs there are without having to fetch them all.  ### Use case  I just want to know how many of a particular format of a log pattern was captured at a particular time. I don't want the log data.  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] Automatically weave into the thread pool without modifying the business code
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  Currently, we must wrap the Runnable or Callable object with RunnableWrapper or CallableWrapper. when we want to pass a traceId across the thread.  java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor is generally used in bussiness projects. Business developers won't want to change their codes when the project is weaved by apm agent.  so i think it is necessary to develop a agent plugin to weave into java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor automatically. And i have achived it in my project, it works. I want to hear your opinion. Thanks!  ### Use case  We provide another choice for developers and it is helpful to promote APM in a company.  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] Adjust K8s monitoring entity structure.
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  By leveraging the latest layer concept, the k8s monitoring structure should be updated too. FYI @mrproliu   Currently, the service is the cluster, the k8s node is the instance, and the endpoint is the endpoint. As `group` is available for cluster, and the `k8s-cluster::` has been replaced by layer already, we should consider  - `cluster as group` - `K8s service as service` - `K8s pod as instance` if pod metric is available. I can see it in the metric graph as labels. - `K8s node as endpoint`  ### Use case  _No response_  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] [BanyanDB] Replication mechanism inside cluster.
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  BanyanDB should support a replication mechanism for making the server more stable and optimization for queries. This replication only happens inside the cluster, with high network quality(high speed and low latency). column3: [BanyanDB] Build document generator
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  BanyanDB leverage [protoc-gen-doc](https://github.com/pseudomuto/protoc-gen-doc) to generate a single-page API reference. It's very convenient for the current API volume, even with some tiny flaws(the name of generated anchor contains upper case letters, which is not compatible with the official document generator).   When more APIs emerge, the single page will not be ideal. Moreover, the future RESTFul APIs need the generator to output Openapi formatted files unsupported by "protoc-gen-doc". Based on those, we have to build a custom API document generator to build both gRPC and RESTful APIs and split them into several individual files.   ### Use case  _No response_  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

Requests validation is an important part of any API. Before you are ready to serve the request, itâ€™s important to make sure the client has supplied a minimum necessary set of input data.  https://github.com/envoyproxy/protoc-gen-validate will help us enhance the validation of gRPC requests.   ### Use case  _No response_  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] Add apache kylin jdbc plugin
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  Apache Kylinâ„¢ is an open source, distributed Analytical Data Warehouse for Big Data; it was designed to provide OLAP (Online Analytical Processing) capability in the big data era. By renovating the multi-dimensional cube and precalculation technology on Hadoop and Spark, Kylin is able to achieve near constant query speed regardless of the ever-growing data volume. Reducing query latency from minutes to sub-second, Kylin brings online analytics back to big data.  ### Use case  when we use apache kylind jdbc to get data, this plugin can get the executed sql and  target server,  execution time,  execution statusã€‚   ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  After we have https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/8720, we could build a more aggressive mechanism. All downsampling metrics(hour/day) could be calculated inside BanyanDB, because with rows mergeable with custom `function`, the downsampling just requires the same aggregation function mechanism with `timestamp` downsampling(minute->hour, minute->day) and a new logic table name.  One NOTICE before begin this, we should know, database kernel level trigger+function aggregation would make more flush write to hour/day metrics(but this is limited).  ### Use case  _No response_  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

Add one hook in [pre-commit](https://pre-commit.com/#new-hooks) could be a solution.  ### Use case  place `license-eye` hook in `.pre-commit-config.yaml`, like  ```yaml - repo: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-eyes   rev: v0.2.0   hooks:     - id: license-eye-header-check     - id: license-eye-header-fix ```  precommit install-hooks then every new file will be checked and fixed before commit.  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Core] Update metadata on the fly
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  Add a notifier between metadata and stream/measure modules to update data module definition dynamically.  This feat is critical to measure whose tagsâ€˜ number and content depend on the data OAP ingest. The OAP can't get a full definition of such metrics when booting up the banyandb. That means the metadata would be updated from time to time.  This notifier will send changes to relevant modules which should update the metadata on the fly. The expired data generated by the old metadata would be cleaned up by TTL.  ### Use case  _No response_  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] Support limitation and circuit break per GraphQL request
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  _No response_  ### Use case  By leveraging the GraphQL query, users could initial a 1k+ sub GraphQL queries/mutations in one single HTTP request. Then this could crash the OAP server.  It is better we could provide a feature with a configuration to set up the number limitation. And response error if too many requests in one HTTP call.  We need to check whether we could do this in today's GraphQL framework.  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] Monitoring MySQL Server
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  @yswdqz finished his first contribution in https://github.com/apache/skywalking-java/pull/286. This is a huge step for a new contributor. After this, he DM me asking for a new place to continue his contributions to the SkyWalking community.  So, I want to begin a new extension for SkyWalking's monitoring target - **Database server**.  Right now, we have a **Virtual Database** layer to monitor database performance from a tracing perspective(analyzing metrics from database access spans). But Database Server in the topology is not observed directly.  In this new issue, I want to work with @yswdqz and assist him to help on adding MySQL server monitoring in the SkyWalking 9.2 or 9.3 release  ### Use case  There are several steps we could follow to do this research and further work  ## Background  Unlike tracing relative monitoring, SkyWalking could do observability through a pure metrics ecosystem. Such as, we use OpenTelemetry collector + OpenCensus exporter to monitor Linux and K8s. I prefer we continue this tech stack for MySQL server monitoring.  The dataflow would be `MySQL Server` -> `OpenTelemetry Collector` -> `SkyWalking OpenCensus Receiver` -> `MAL engine`  ## Steps 1. Do research about the ways of MySQL server and OpenTelemetry integration. Various blogs such as [this](https://observiq.com/blog/how-to-monitor-mysql-with-opentelemetry/)(just a reference) introduce how this could work. 2. We discuss and pick one possible solution. 3. Learn [MAL](https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/concepts-and-designs/mal/) and get ideas about how to use MAL to analyze metrics. Could take a look at K8s and Linux monitoring. 4. Discuss which metrics we should do for the MySQL server. We could involve more people in this part, such as ppl from MySQL or ShardingSphere community. I could help with this. 5. Add `MySQL` layer to OAP, and begin to set up dashboards(can't be a menu for now) 6. When all dashboards are ready, we could ask @Fine0830 to help with moving `virtual database` as a sub-menu of general service(So, general service could have two children, services and virtual database). And change the `virtual database` to `Database`, then add `MySQL` as a sub and a root layer.  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] [OAP + BanyanDB] [Test] Support OAP running in simulation test mode
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  @hanahmily @kezhenxu94 and I had a discussion a week ago, with BanyanDB 0.1 MVP version is going to be ready soon. We need to establish a mode to make OAP could generate simulated traces/metrics/logs without target services and agents installed/deployed  So, I suppose we should create a new maven and OAP module, as well as a new binary(tar and docker image), to provide configurations in `application.yml`.    ### Use case  In this simulation test mode, developers could provide trace/log/metric templates as well as parameters to control data set of simulated telemetry data.  Notice, this module and binary should not be generated in both default package and release package  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [NGINX-LUA] support custom operation ignore
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  1.support operation ignore according to some custom configs like: . ignore: /test,/heathCheck/ . ignorePrefix: /css/,/html/ . ignoreSuffix: .css,.html  2.in reverse proxy case, the sw8 header will not be transmitted to the upstream for ignored operation  ### Use case  1.support custom operation ignore We do not need to record all request like some static resources. column3: [Feature]  Logback log collection function cannot be used
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  **I refer to the official website documents to introduce dependency packages:** `` `         org.apache.skywalking` `         apm-toolkit-logback-1.x` `         8.7.0` ``  **[logback-spring.xml]  The configuration is as follows ï¼š**     `` `        ` `            ` `                %d{yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS} [%tid] [%thread] %-5level %logger{36} -%msg%n` `            ` `        ` `  ` `  ` `      ` `  `  However, rocketbot does not display log information ï¼š ![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2177178/138379094-faeb6af6-2b37-4f73-aaad-ca65e76ee345.png)     ### Use case   The rocketbot has log information, or the agent prints alarm information to indicate the failure reason   ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] [SWCK] Supports Kubernetes 1.22.x
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  **Apache SkyWalking Cloud on Kubernetes** can't be deployed on Kubernetes 1.22.x since some deprecated API is used by the **SWCK**.  **SWCK** should have a plan to support the latest Kubernetes.  ### Use case  To support Kubernetes 1.22.x,  the following API reference need to be upgraded:  apiextensions.k8s.io/v1beta1 -> apiextensions.k8s.io/v1, available since v1.16 apiregistration.k8s.io/v1beta1 ->  apiregistration.k8s.io/v1, available since v1.10 Ingress  networking.k8s.io/v1beta1 -> networking.k8s.io/v1, available since v1.19  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] set instance properties in json format: `agent.instance_properties_json`
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description  > I find some configurations are in configurations.md , but not in the agent.config , such as ```agent.trace_segment_ref_limit_per_span``` ã€```agent.instance_properties[key]=value``` . Otherwise , the configuration ```plugin.dubbo.consumer_provider_length_threshold ``` in the agent.config is not the same as ```plugin.dubbo.provider_arguments_length_threshold``` in the configurations.md.    @dashanji can you open a pull request to fix this? For `agent.instance_properties[xxx]`, I think we also need to migrate to the format of `agent.instance_properties_json={}`.  `plugin.dubbo.consumer_provider_length_threshold` should be typo of `plugin.dubbo.consumer_length_threshold`  _Originally posted by @kezhenxu94 in https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/7470#issuecomment-922471256_  ### Use case  For containerized scenarios, we should be able to set the `agent.instance_properties` easily via environment variables, instead of modifying the config file.  ### Related issues  https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/7470#issuecomment-922471256  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] Add HikariCP plugin
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description   HikariCP is a solid, high-performance, JDBC connection pool at last. Starting from Spring boot 2.0, It is the default JDBC Connection Pool. Provide skywalking java-agent with  HikariCP plug-in.      ### Use case  When the application service uses Hikari Connection Pool, it tracks the acquisition and closing of connections.  ### Related issues  Nothing.  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] Support tags auto-complete for trace/log query
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description   Current tags are available(if searchable) for query in log and trace page, but the user experience is not very good. Considering the full Zipkin server support(https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/8932), OAP and UI could finish the tag auto-complete feature, like lens UI did. We need to do this to support Lens UI, then why don't we support this for native trace and log too.  ### Use case  _No response_  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature]  add annotations for oap.service (skywalking-kubernetes )
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description   add annotations for oap.service  just like ui.service.annotations   ### Use case  When opa.service.type is set to loadBalancer, you need to customize the loadBalancer by setting annotations, just like ui.service.annotations. It's a bit strange why didn't add annotations support?  ``` oap:   name: oap   image:     tag: 8.9.1   storageType: elasticsearch   replicas: 2   service:     type: loadBalancer     annotations:       service.beta.kubernetes.io/alibaba-cloud-loadbalancer-id: "lb-bp16j1jvwlwxxxxxxx"         service.beta.kubernetes.io/alibaba-cloud-loadbalancer-force-override-listeners: "true"   ```  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: Skywalking failed to submit log
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description    Phenomenon: the springboot project uses the logback method to report logs to skywalking 8.7. Logback.xml and agent.config are configured. After the springboot project is started, the access interface does not report errors, and the skywalking background does not report errors, but there are warnings. You can find that the interface is called in the skywalking page, but the log list is empty  Environment: the springboot project and agent are on the same machine, and skywalking 8.7 is deployed on another machine ![ä¼ä¸šå¾®ä¿¡æˆªå›¾_16353207402171](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88814006/139022382-df687323-2db3-499e-a515-1b1b6f42e88a.png)  ![ä¼ä¸šå¾®ä¿¡æˆªå›¾_16353207118134](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88814006/139022330-e6beafbf-f7c8-4d79-9530-fc4abe6dd751.png) ![ä¼ä¸šå¾®ä¿¡æˆªå›¾_16353207635085](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88814006/139022439-5e7874d5-78c6-4457-a63d-8d078f883b22.png) ![ä¼ä¸šå¾®ä¿¡æˆªå›¾_16353207936924](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88814006/139022517-f1e3cbaf-c330-414b-a56b-35764b3940e5.png) ![ä¼ä¸šå¾®ä¿¡æˆªå›¾_16353208703025](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88814006/139022746-48c946bb-6011-4902-be24-5d767324878f.png)   ### Use case  _No response_  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] [UI] Consider to add an avg number for metrics of service/instance/endpoint list?
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description    In v9, we have a linear graph on the service/instance/endpoint list, could we have a summary(avg calculation by UI) value on the table, and use a pop-out graph to show the trend?  By that, I am thinking to add all red metrics, (1) load (2) success rate (3) apdex on one table, and also would not make too many graphs on one page.  ### Use case  _No response_  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature] RESTful style APIs
column4: ### Search before asking  - [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar feature requirement.   ### Description    BanyanDB tends to provide APIs in RESTful style and gRPC at the same time. The RESTful APIs is exploited to:  * Simplify the authentication and authorization process according to HTTP 1.1 * Leverage OpenAPIs to enhance the documents of APIs  [gRPC gateway](https://github.com/grpc-ecosystem/grpc-gateway) is the canonical path to implement this feature. It reads protobuf service definitions and generates a reverse-proxy server which translates a RESTful HTTP API into gRPC. This server is generated according to the [google.api.http](https://github.com/googleapis/googleapis/blob/master/google/api/http.proto#L46) annotations in your service definitions.  A[ gRPC official post](https://grpc.io/blog/coreos/) represents more details around this topic.    ### Use case  _No response_  ### Related issues  _No response_  ### Are you willing to submit a PR?  - [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: Remove `logback` dependencies in IoTDB plugin

column4: ### Introduce the entity of Process Type 1. The Process type entity could be created through the EBPF process service. It's at the next level of Service Instance.  2. There is no complete E2E test yet, I will add it after I complete the Profiling function of the Rover project.   - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).

column3: OAP-stream integration with Banyandb
column4: ### Introduce OAP integration with BanyanDB stream  - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [ ] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature.  - [x] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #7732 - [ ] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).  This PR intends to integrate stream related entities to BanyanDB. And this is the last task listed in issue #7732   I will open another issue to track the remaining features which are not currently supported by BanyanDB but are used in the query protocol of OAP server.  UT and documents will be added later.  @hanahmily

Convert Service dashboard in Kubernetes service to tab widget.  4. Convert Service dashboard in Service Mesh Data Plane to tab widget.   ### Screenshots: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3417650/167567263-817e69f2-42cb-4e87-b075-7fc42018b020.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3417650/167567376-695c9f11-5ad4-4468-bfd4-f14ea98bfb1d.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3417650/167568152-d495995d-4815-4f45-ac43-667c527fce78.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3417650/167577672-5b8a645f-2b1a-4b0c-b337-9ba7169ef49a.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3417650/167577466-e7ba04fd-14f2-4125-8750-6d1c1e62401c.png)   - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/changelog/docs/en/changes/changes.md).

column3: Improve the performance of TermsAggregation
column4: ### Improve the performance of TermsAggregation  When skywalking queries the topology map, it uses queryTopoInfo to query the corresponding information. When it finds that it takes a long time, the main time-consuming statements are as follows,add ` "execution_hint": "map",          "collect_mode": "breadth_first",`there is about a 5-10x performance difference.  **My index table sw89_metrics-percent size is about 300GB/day** ``` POST /sw89_metrics-percent/_search {   "size": 0,   "query": {     "bool": {       "must": [         {           "range": {             "time_bucket": {               "gte": 202204212336,               "lte": 202204212351             }           }         },         {           "terms": {             "entity_id": [               "xxx1"             ]           }         },         {           "term": {             "metric_table": "service_sla"           }         }       ]     }   },   "aggregations": {     "entity_id": {       "terms": {         "field": "entity_id",         "size": 1       },       "aggregations": {         "percentage": {           "avg": {             "field": "percentage"           }         }       }     }   } } ```

column3: Enhance Deprecated MetricQuery(v1) getValues querying
column4: ### Improve the performance of MetricQuery When querying getValues, metrics.getIds() costs  metrics.size * per request, so I modified it to asynchronous concurrencyï¼ŒIt can improve the query efficiency of the topology mapã€‚

column3: Fix scroll query in Elastic Search storage
column4: ### Fix Scroll query in Elastic Search storage If the `SW_STORAGE_ES_SCROLLING_BATCH_SIZE` environment config is less them the Service entity count, it would throw `No search context found for id` exception. The root cause is we're going to close the scroll after we've requested it once.   ### Add `profileDataQueryBatchSize` config in Elastic Search storage EBPF Profiling Data stores a large amount of symbol data. When a large amount of data content is queried at one time, a `ContentTooLargeException` from netty will occur, so I add a new config for the query.   - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/changelog/docs/en/changes/changes.md).

column3: Support receive Kubernetes process from the Rover
column4: ### Fix create eBPF profiling task failure If the start time of the Profiling task is later than the start time of the task to be created, the two-time intervals do not overlap. At present, an error will be prompted, in fact, it should be able to be created normally.  ### Support receive Kubernetes process from the Rover - [x] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/changelog/docs/en/changes/changes.md).  For now, I use YAML config to deploy the rover into the Kubernetes. I think after the Rover has a released version, it could be added to the helm.

column3: Fixes Banynadb race condition
column4: ### Fix #9359  The issue exists because BanyanDBBatchDAO is used by multiple threads but `initialized.compareAndSet(false, true)` is set before the values it's supposed to initialize are actually initialized.  My method of multithreaded protection probably isn't the best, but it works. Let me know if I should use another method.

column3: Fix the problem that MQ has the wrong layer type(#9080)
column4: ### Fix  - [x] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works. Before:   After:   - [x] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it. >  when OAP analysises service relations from segments, the source layer type of the service agent_test_3 is set `LAYER.VIRTUAL_MQ`, however, the target layer type of the service agent_test_2 is set `LAYER.MQ`. it result in the same kafka service id of the two spans are different, then, it causes the wrong topology. - [x] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #9080. - [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/changelog/docs/en/changes/changes.md).

column3: Dashboards adapte mobile terminal
column4: ### Discussed in https://github.com/apache/skywalking/discussions/8871    Originally posted by **warrmr** April 14, 2022 We are in the process of trialing Skywalking in our apps and we love it so far the response time from the developers on issues is amazing and the charts and ease of first time setup is awesome. We got a few issues to iron out but the overall experience is great.   So much so I cant stop checking the dashboard looking at all the pretty graphs :) However the dashboard ui isn't very mobile friendly (see screenshot) is it in the pipeline to make it nicer for mobile please ;)   ![Image from iOS (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/393693/163282747-90ec2c70-b0c1-4cf7-b88b-8bfb34516833.jpg)

column3: Add â€œ.exeâ€ suffix to the Windows compiled executable program for  skywalking-eyes
column4: ### Discussed in https://github.com/apache/skywalking/discussions/7844    Originally posted by **codeglzhang** September 30, 2021  In skywalking-infra-e2e, we can use `make build` to get a Windows executable program `skywalking-eyes\bin\windows\license-eye`. However, in the command line of Windows, whether the file is an executable program is determined by whether the file has a specific suffix, such as ".exe". Thus, commands such as  `bin/darwin/license-eye -c test/testdata/.licenserc_for_test_fix.yaml header check` will not be executed correctly under Windows.  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17879307/135402537-93e625f4-d376-4995-b692-344896a18938.png) After renaming the file `skywalking-eyes\bin\windows\license-eye` to `skywalking-eyes\bin\windows\license-eye.exe`, the command is executed. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17879307/135402746-a394f342-8e98-422c-bd38-c822385bfb31.png) The same is true for `skywalking-infra-e2e`.

column3: Does skywalking-eyes support SPDX-short-identifiers?
column4: ### Discussed in https://github.com/apache/skywalking/discussions/7756    Originally posted by **tisonkun** September 20, 2021 https://spdx.github.io/spdx-spec/appendix-V-using-SPDX-short-identifiers-in-source-files/  It seems the checker only allows full-text license header.  cc @kezhenxu94 @fgksgf

column3: [Core] Metric data processing
column4: ### Description  This intends to track the progress of handling the metric data.  We slipped the topic into several tasks:  - [x] Protobuf APIs (https://github.com/apache/skywalking-banyandb/pull/57) - [x] KV storage improvement: add interceptors on flushing and compacting to support value encoding and compression.(https://github.com/SkyAPM/badger/commit/7f8fa9a51476cfd07f7cf90d95d9b80dd70e8de7) - [x] Measure module: parsing protocols, writing, reading. - [x] Query - [x] Liaison - [x] Java client  ### Code of Conduct  - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)

column3: [Feature][Showcase] Java agent injection for kubernetes
column4: ### Description  Introduce a new case that shows how the java agent injector works to showcase repo.  We can add a new `feature` into the repo by referring to the [agentless case](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-showcase/blob/9b9e6a7f661df67e9d0396afe972da2cff1bfe61/deploy/platform/kubernetes/features.mk?_pjax=%23js-repo-pjax-container%2C%20div%5Bitemtype%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fschema.org%2FSoftwareSourceCode%22%5D%20main%2C%20%5Bdata-pjax-container%5D#L57) which is recommended by @kezhenxu94   In this feature, we should    * create a new namespace for the operator  * deploy the swck operator.  * remove the java app image with the java agent. Use the java agent injector to attach the official agent image.  * update the agent's backend address to the `single-node` or `cluster` feature. (Their address is identical. One of them should be deployed with this feature)  @dashanji Do you interest in this?  @wu-sheng @kezhenxu94 any insight about this?

column3: Add storage column attribute `indexOnly`
column4: ### Add storage column attribute `indexOnly` - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [X] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.  - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [X] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).  Add storage column attribute `indexOnly`, support ElasticSearch only index, and not store some fields. Add `indexOnly=true` to `SegmentRecord.tags`, `AlarmRecord.tags`, `AbstractLogRecord.tags`, to reduce unnecessary storage.

column3: SQL Database: provide `@SQLDatabase.AdditionalEntity` to support create additional tables from a model.
column4: ###  - [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc. - [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature. - [X] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature. - [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below. - [x] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #8931. - [X] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/changelog/docs/en/changes/changes.md).  * SQL Database: provide `@SQLDatabase.AdditionalEntity` to support create additional tables from a model.  * [Breaking Change] SQL Database: remove SQL Database config `maxSizeOfArrayColumn` and `numOfSearchableValuesPerTag`. * [Breaking Change] SQL Database: move `Tags list` from `Segment`,`Logs`,`Alarms` to their additional table.
